title: cafter
author: cafter
content: like we play on gambling site and want to withdraw our crypto then we just need to type the amount we need to withdraw and click on "withdraw" button. then our withdrawal request get approved in a second, and goes directly to the blockchain. my question is what is the process of withdrawal on most of the sites, which is so fast and without any double spending or issue like that?

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on July 07, 2023, 07:11:57 PMmy question is what is the process of withdrawal on most of the sites, which is so fast and without any double spending or issue like that?Are you asking that from the developer side of things? As far as I know, most casinos use some form of payment provider that handles the actual transaction process.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on July 07, 2023, 07:11:57 PMlike we play on gambling site and want to withdraw our crypto then we just need to type the amount we need to withdraw and click on "withdraw" button. then our withdrawal request get approved in a second, and goes directly to the blockchain. my question is what is the process of withdrawal on most of the sites, which is so fast and without any double spending or issue like that?Withdrawal request on most casinos and exchanges are approved in the batches so there is no such thing called the approval happens in a second. But we had some casinos with instant withdrawal feature which charge more fee and only process our transaction but they are the one sending funds to users so they won't be double spending them unless the site is scam.The process of withdrawal as of now withdrawal -> wait for approval -> onchain transaction (needs enough confirmation) -> balance will credit on the receiving end.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on July 07, 2023, 07:11:57 PMmy question is what is the process of withdrawal on most of the sites, which is so fast and without any double spending or issue like that?If you are withdrawing BTC from any custodial website into your own wallet address controlled by you, then it follows the same normal tx process. The website will usually broadcast your transaction and that of others together, if they pay a high tx fee you'll get the BTC quickly into your address like every normal tx, if they use a low tx fee, you will have to wait for confirmation.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I don't hear of any gambling sites that have fast withdrawals unless you talking about a lightning transaction or other coins/token that doesn't need confirmation?Another thing is I never heard of any gambling sites that do double spending unless they want to bump a fee.Only the wallet owner who can do double spending if needed for bumping fees.Is there anything else that you are afraid of?

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on July 07, 2023, 07:11:57 PMmy question is what is the process of withdrawal on most of the sites, which is so fast and without any double spending or issue like that?It depends on the site. Some take slightly long, while others take 1–3 minutes to broadcast the transaction. For example, when I am sending funds from exchanges like Binance, MEXC, Phemex. The transaction gets approved very fast as soon as i am done with approving the 2FA and email confirmation.I had a very good experience with bustadice too sometime back. There were no delays when you chose the instant withdrawal option.

comments.author: taufik123
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on July 07, 2023, 10:19:38 PMI don't hear of any gambling sites that have fast withdrawals unless you talking about a lightning transaction or other coins/token that doesn't need confirmation?-snip-Fast Withdrawals other than having to increase the Gas fee can use the Lightning Network. I know an online casino that applies Lightning Network to withdrawals and deposits, such as https://betplay.io. Withdrawals and deposits will be made quickly and at a reduced cost. Quote from: logfiles on July 07, 2023, 11:48:21 PMQuote from: cafter on July 07, 2023, 07:11:57 PMmy question is what is the process of withdrawal on most of the sites, which is so fast and without any double spending or issue like that?It depends on the site. Some take slightly long, while others take 1–3 minutes to broadcast the transaction. For example, when I am sending funds from exchanges like Binance, MEXC, Phemex. The transaction gets approved very fast as soon as i am done with approving the 2FA and email confirmation.-snip-That is the normal time, withdrawals take time to confirm and as I mentioned it also depends on how much Gas Fee is used. If using an Exchange the confirmation time is usually 1-3 minutes and it could be longer depending on how the Bitcoin network is doing. If there is a spike in transactions like a few months ago then confirmation will take longer and can even be more than 24 hours. However, instant transactions can be made using the P2P feature between internal exchanges.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on July 07, 2023, 07:11:57 PMlike we play on gambling site and want to withdraw our crypto then we just need to type the amount we need to withdraw and click on "withdraw" button. then our withdrawal request get approved in a second, and goes directly to the blockchain. Just a correction. The bitcoin on the gambling site that you withdraw is on the blockchain. While as you send it, it remains on the blockchain. Only what happens is that the UTXO is spent and sent to your bitcoin address. In short, bitcoin is stored on the blockchain.Quote from: cafter on July 07, 2023, 07:11:57 PMmy question is what is the process of withdrawal on most of the sites, which is so fast and without any double spending or issue like that?If you are referring to sites, I do not know what this thread is doing on development and technical discussion. It supposed to be on service discussion. If you are referring to noncustodial wallets, transaction on noncustodial wallets are the fastest because it is your private key, unlike on centralized platforms that it is not your key. Any transaction made on noncustodial wallet is created by you. But any transaction you make on your account on centralized platform, it has to be authorized by the platform. So noncustodial wallet transaction are faster.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on July 07, 2023, 08:02:04 PMQuote from: cafter on July 07, 2023, 07:11:57 PMmy question is what is the process of withdrawal on most of the sites, which is so fast and without any double spending or issue like that?Are you asking that from the developer side of things? As far as I know, most casinos use some form of payment provider that handles the actual transaction process. Usually it's just a piece of software that can be remote-controlled to create a transaction and send it away, to the user.But everyone knows that's not how fast withdrawals actually work, there's usually some other software running forensics on the account to make sure that it's not cheating, "mixing coins", doing arbitrage or any other shady stuff.

comments.author: cryptoworld99
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on July 07, 2023, 07:11:57 PMlike we play on gambling site and want to withdraw our crypto then we just need to type the amount we need to withdraw and click on "withdraw" button. then our withdrawal request get approved in a second, and goes directly to the blockchain. my question is what is the process of withdrawal on most of the sites, which is so fast and without any double spending or issue like that?In simple terms you can create a code in mostly any programming language, all you need is a "node" to compile and broadcast the transaction for the miners to mine and verify the block your transaction is broadcasted in, this process takes a few seconds.
